author: Michael Howden

comments.message: How critical would your services be in a quarantine situation?
This would depend on the exact needs and challenges faced. What specific solution do you imagine being needed?

I'd like to see a 21 day quarantine at the epicenter so that we wouldn't have to transfer resources to other --  random -- places like a cruise ship in Belize.  Look at how much money has been spent on containing the outfall from one random traveler to the US.  Some people feel like this would be leaving these three countries to their own means.  I believe it would help the world focus our attention on the countries that are completely overwhelmed.   How could your services help solve problems that would be isolated to these three countries in the epicenter?   Thank you in advance. Very nice post.

Implementing a quarantine is a policy level decision that would need to be made by health authorities and governments. We could offer technology solutions which could help them address challenges raised by the quarantine.

description:
Sahana Open Source Disaster Management Web Application can provide solutions to a a wide range of information management, tracking and communication challenges. Sahana modules for:

Patient Contact Tracing/Monitoring - Tracking who infected patients have been in contact with to allow ongoing monitoring to prevent further outbreaks

Logistics & Donation Management - Managing what supplies are needed, requested, shipped and donated either with a single organisation or between multiple organisations.

Health Worker / Personnel - Tracking and communicating with Health Workers and other personnel involved in the response.

Hospital & Health Facility Management - Managing and mapping Hospital & Health Facility including their status, capacities and requirements.

Who's Doing What Where - tracking which organisations are responding to the outbreak, what activities they are doing and where.

In addition to Sahana's existing modules, new modules can quickly be developed to provide custom solutions to new challenges that may be faced by organisations responding to the Ebola Outbreak. These solutions can easily be integrated into the existing modules as well as utilizing Sahana's full framework including
  • User Permissions & Security
  • Messaging (Email/SMS/Twitter/IVR)
  • Mapping
  • RESTful API
  • Offline Support
Here are some more details about what the Sahana team are currently working on and can offer to support:
http://eden.sahanafoundation.org/wiki/Deployments/Ebola

A demo site of a Sahana solution to the Ebola Outbreak is available here:   http://ebola.sahanafoundation.org

We are actively looking for partners responding to the Ebola Outbreak who we can support.
Sahana has been used in response to most major disasters over the past ten years in over 25 countries and is currently used by 9 organisations including the Red Cross, NGOs and Government. The Sahana Software Foundation is a 501(c)(3) non-profit registered in the USA.
